<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 1 at the end of this MD&amp;A.&#160;&#160;The calculation of total cash cost per ounce of gold sold for the Peak Mine is net of by-product copper sales revenue.&#160;&#160;The calculation of total cash cost per ounce of gold for the Cerro San Pedro Mine is net of by-product silver sales revenue.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(4)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost per gold ounce sold figures for previous periods have been amended as a result of reclassification of costs between operating costs and depreciation and depletion for the Cerro San Pedro Mine.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	OVERVIEW OF 2009 FINANCIAL RESULTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For year ended December 31, 2009, net loss from continuing operations was $183.4 million, compared to net earnings from continuing operations of $70.9 million from the prior year.&#160;&#160;The decrease in net earnings from continuing operations was primarily driven by a goodwill impairment charge on the Western Goldfields acquisition of $192.1 million and losses on foreign exchange of $52.7 million.&#160;&#160;These decreases were partially offset by increased revenues from higher gold sales, the contribution of the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s gold production, and a gain of $14.2 million on the buyback of long-term debt.&#160;&#160;During 2009, the Company designated the Amapari Mine as a discontinued operation and therefore has presented all financial information for this mine separately from continuing operations.&#160;&#160;The loss recognized on the Amapari Mine, net of taxes, was $10.9 million in 2009 and $173.6 million in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 11
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage199"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cash flows were positively influenced by the increase of gold ounces sold from 237,590 ounces during 2008 to 292,407 ounces in 2009.&#160;&#160;The average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	also increased by 14% from $863 per ounce in 2008 to $983 per ounce in 2009.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Company successfully closed a bought deal equity public offering for gross receipts of $107.2 million on September 11, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	OVERVIEW OF 2009 FOURTH QUARTER FINANCIAL RESULTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the fourth quarter of 2009, net loss from continuing operations was $2.3 million, which decreased from a net income of $39.4 million in the prior year.&#160;&#160;Higher realized gold prices, higher realized copper prices, increased production and lower corporate administration costs were offset by higher operating costs of $67.4 million and losses from foreign exchange of $11.2 million compared to operating costs of $44.2 million and a gain of $54.0 million from foreign exchange during the fourth quarter of 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company sold 106,475 ounces of gold during the fourth quarter of 2009, compared to 77,645 ounces in the third quarter.&#160;&#160;In addition to incremental ounces sold, the increase in average realized price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	of gold sold from $959 to $1,074 per ounce quarter-over-quarter resulted in a 49% increase in revenues to $131.8 million.&#160;&#160;Fourth quarter corporate administration costs was higher at $9.4 million, compared to $5.5 million in the third quarter, as a result of employee bonus accruals and professional services related to addressing the mining disruption at our Cerro San Pedro Mine.&#160;&#160;Business transaction costs of $6.6 million related to the Western Goldfields acquisition was fully accounted for by June 30, 2009.&#160;&#160;Related to the Western Goldfields acquisition were goodwill impairment charges totalling $192.1 million.&#160;&#160;The continuing improvement in credit markets resulted in gains on the investment in AB Notes but was negated by loss on dispositions of the AB Notes for a net loss on investments of $14.6 million in the fourth quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the continued strengthening in exchange rates of foreign currencies in relation to the U.S. dollar has resulted in losses on foreign exchange of $11.2 million in the fourth quarter of 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	OPERATIONS REVIEW
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(tabular data in thousands of U
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	.
</FONT>
	S. dollars unless otherwise stated)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MESQUITE MINE, CALIFORNIA
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s Mesquite Mine is located in Imperial County, California, approximately 70 kilometres northwest of Yuma, Arizona and 230 kilometres east of San Diego, California.&#160;&#160;The Mesquite Mining District lies beneath alluvial pediment deposits at the base of the Chocolate Mountains.&#160;&#160;The mine was operated between 1985 &#8211; 2001 by Goldfields Mining Corporation, subsequently Santa Fe Minerals Corporation, and finally Newmont Mining Corporation with Western Goldfields Inc. acquiring the mine in 2003.&#160;&#160;New Gold acquired the Mesquite Mine as part of the acquisition of Western Goldfields Inc. on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;The mine resumed production in 2008.&#160;&#160;Over the last 23 years, the Mesquite Mine has been subject to significant exploration with over 6,000 reverse circulation drill holes having been completed during its life.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

	Page 12

</TD>

	(1)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Tonnes of ore processed each quarter does not necessarily correspond to ounces produced during the quarter, as there is a time delay between placing tonnes on the leach pad and pouring ounces of gold.
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(3)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(4)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Total
</FONT>
	cash cost is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 1 at the end of this MD&amp;A.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FOURTH QUARTER OF 2009 COMPARED TO FOURTH QUARTER OF 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Gold production for the quarter ended December 31, 2009 was 61,245 ounces compared to 28,378 ounces produced in the same period in 2008.&#160;&#160;Gold production was higher in the fourth quarter of 2009 compared to fourth quarter of 2008 due to greater ore tonnes placed and higher ore grades.&#160;&#160;Total tonnes placed on the leach pad in the fourth quarter of 2009 were 4.4 million tonnes compared to 2.4 million tonnes in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;Period over period, the average head grade increased to 0.63 g/t from 0.47 g/t.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue for the quarter ended December 31, 2009 was $58.2 million compared to $24.5 million in the same period last year due largely to an increase in ounces sold to 55,861 ounces in 2009 from 30,625 ounces in 2008.&#160;&#160;The average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	during the fourth quarter of $1,041 per ounce, including hedged gold ounce settlements at $801 per ounce, was lower than the average London Metals Exchange PM gold fix price of $1,100 per ounce.&#160;&#160;In the fourth quarter of 2008, the Mesquite Mine recognized an average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	of $799 per ounce of gold sold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold for the quarter ended December 2009 was $551 per ounce compared to $519 per ounce in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;The increase in cash cost was driven primarily by increased costs associated with equipment maintenance repair, increased cyanide consumption and high wall remediation in the Rainbow pit by a contract miner. In addition, gold ounces were sold from inventory that had been accounted for at higher costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 14
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage202"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Capital expenditures totaled $0.3 million and $2.6 million for the three month periods ended December 31, 2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160;&#160;The decrease was the result of the completion of the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s expansion program by the end of 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	YEAR ENDED 2009 COMPARED TO YEAR ENDED 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	(Full Year &#8211; Not Period of Ownership)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Gold production for the year ended December 31, 2009 was 150,002 ounces compared to 108,325 ounces produced in 2008, due to more tonnes placed on the leach pads and secondary leaching offset by lower head grades.&#160;&#160;Ore placed on the leach pad increased to 4.4 million from 2.4 million tonnes in 2008, representing an increase of 83%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue for the year ended December 31, 2009 was $136.0 million compared to $95.4 million in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;The increase in revenue was a result of an increase in ounces sold to 143,509 from 110,880.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	of $955 per ounce was higher in 2009 compared to $861 per ounce in 2008.&#160;&#160;The average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	during the year ended December 31, 2009 of $955 per ounce was lower than the average London Metals Exchange PM gold fix price of $972 per ounce, due principally to the Company delivering 66,000 ounces into its gold hedge program at a price of $801 per ounce.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold for the year ended December 31, 2009 was $596 compared to $508 in the same period last year.&#160;&#160;During 2009, the Mesquite Mine incurred additional costs due to lower truck availability.&#160;&#160;As a result, maintenance and repair costs increased during this period, and a contract miner was utilized to assist with waste stripping in the Rainbow mining area.&#160;&#160;Increased expenditures were also incurred for increased usage of cyanide and lime to optimize recovery.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Capital expenditures totaled $1.3 million and $2
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	0.
</FONT>
	3 million for the years ended December 31, 2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160;&#160;The decrease was the result of the completion of the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s expansion program by the end of 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	2010 GUIDANCE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Mesquite mine is forecast to produce 145,000 to 155,000 ounces of gold in 2010 at total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	of $540 to $560 per ounce sold.&#160;&#160;While gold production is anticipated to remain consistent with the levels achieved in 2009, total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	is expected to decline as certain one-time costs incurred in 2009, including tire replacement, contract mining and high repairs and maintenance, are not expected to re-occur.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;CERRO SAN PEDRO, MEXICO
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Cerro San Pedro Mine is located in the state of San Luis Potos&#237; in central Mexico, approximately 20 kilometres east of the city of San Luis Potos&#237;.&#160;&#160;The project property consists of 52 mining and exploration concessions totalling 78 square kilometres in the historic Cerro San Pedro mining district.&#160;&#160;The mine was acquired pursuant to the Metallica Resources Inc. acquisition on June 30, 2008.&#160;&#160;The current focus of exploration is on the southern half of a two-plus kilometre San Pedro trend of gold-silver-zinc-lead mineralization that extends south from beneath the Company&#8217;s current open pit mine operation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="HDR">

	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Cerro San Pedro Mine was awarded the highest safety award granted from the Mexican Chamber of Mines (&#8220;CAMIMEX&#8221;).&#160;&#160;It also achieved ISO 14001 certification of its environmental management system.&#160;&#160;New Gold&#8217;s Cerro San Pedro Mine has a record of compliance with Mexican and international environmental standards.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	The Cerro San Pedro Mine&#8217;s operations are included in New Gold&#8217;s operating results for the period subsequent to July 1, 2008 only.
</FONT>

	&#160;

	&#160;

	&#160;Year ended
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="13%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;Period July 1
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="29%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	(3)&#160;&#160;

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The calculation of total cash cost per ounce of gold is net of by-product silver revenue.&#160;&#160;If the silver revenues were treated as a co-product, average total cash cost at Cerro San Pedro for the three months ended December 31, 2009, would be $541 per ounce of gold (2008 - $533) and $8.71 per ounce of silver (2008 - $6.73), and for the year ended December 31, 2009, $515 per ounce of gold (2008 -$488) and $7.63 per ounce of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	silver (2008 - $7.40).
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Realized price is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 2 at the end of this MD&amp;A.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(5)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;&#160;See Endnote 1 at the end of this MD&amp;A.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost per gold ounce sold figures for previous periods have been restated as a result of reclassification of costs between operating costs and depreciation and depletion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Tonnes of ore processed each quarter do not necessarily correspond to ounces produced during the quarter, as there is a time delay between placing tonnes on the leach pad and pouring ounces of gold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(2)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The calculation of total cash cost per ounce of gold is net of by-product silver revenue.&#160;&#160;If the silver revenues were treated as a co-product, average total cash cost at Cerro San Pedro for the three months ended December 31, 2009, would be $541 per ounce of gold (2008 - $533) and $8.71 per ounce of silver (2008 - $6.73), and for the year ended December 31, 2009, $515 per ounce of gold (2008 -$484) and $7.63 per ounce of silver (2008 - $8.24).
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(3)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Realized price is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 2 at the end of this MD&amp;A.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(4)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 1 at the end of this MD&amp;A.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost per gold ounce sold figures for previous periods have been restated as a result of reclassification of costs between operating costs and depreciation and depletion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FOURTH QUARTER OF 2009 COMPARED TO FOURTH QUARTER OF 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Gold production for the fourth quarter of 2009 increased by 21% to 25,781 ounces, compared to 21,231 ounces produced in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;The increase in production over the fourth quarter of 2008 was due to an increase in the ore tonnes mined, which offset a decrease in gold grades.&#160;&#160;Silver production increased during the quarter to 312,848 ounces from 290,520 ounces in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;This increase in silver production can be attributed to the increase in the ore tons placed on the leach pads during the fourth quarter of 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold in the fourth quarter of 2009 was $436 per ounce compared to $487 per ounce in the same prior year period, representing a decrease of 10%.&#160;&#160;This was due to a number of factors, including higher silver prices, a lower strip ratio, and lower operating costs due to the temporary suspension of mining activities.&#160;&#160;These factors, in conjunction with the increase in silver ounces sold, resulted in lower fourth quarter total cash costs
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 17
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage205"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue for the fourth quarter of 2009 was $31.6 million, which was a 59% or $11.7 million increase over the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;The main driver for this increase was increased average realized prices.&#160;&#160;The average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	per ounce during the fourth quarter 2009 and 2008 was $1,079 and $799, respectively, which corresponds well to the average London Metals Exchange PM gold fix price of $1,100 and $795 per ounce, respectively.&#160;&#160;The average realized silver price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	per ounce during the fourth quarter 2009 and 2008 was $17.36 and $10.09, respectively, which also correlates to the average London Metals Exchange silver fix price of $17.57 and $10.21 per ounce, respectively.&#160;&#160;In addition, silver ounces sold increased by 8,326 ounces while gold ounces sold increased from 21,180 in the fourth quarter of 2008 to 24,455 ounces in the fourth quarter of 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On November 18, 2009, PROFEPA, the Mexican environmental enforcement agency, issued an order requiring the Cerro San Pedro Mine to suspend mining as a consequence of the nullification of the mine&#8217;s EIS.&#160;&#160;Since the suspension of mining activities, the mine was still able to continue gold recovery operations of existing inventory on the leach pads.&#160;&#160;&#160;Mining operations resumed in December after the Company was granted an injunction which temporarily overturns the PROFEPA order to suspend mining operations.&#160;&#160;The Cerro San Pedro Mine produced 25,781 ounces of gold in the fourth quarter of 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Subsequent to December 31, 2009, the Company was scheduled to face a hearing in the Fourth District Court in San Luis Potosi, related to a challenge by opposition to the mine to the annual renewal of the explosives permit at Cerro San Pedro.&#160;&#160;The Company is vigorously defending against this challenge and a hearing is scheduled for March 2010.&#160;&#160;Until the hearing is held, no additional blasting will take place at Cerro San Pedro.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Capital expenditures totalled $1.5 million and $2.0 million for the three month periods ended December 31, 2009 and 2008, respectively.&#160;&#160;2009 expenditures were primarily on the construction of leach cells 6 and 7, whereas 2008 expenditures were primarily on process improvements and the site&#8217;s communication infrastructure.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	YEAR ENDED 2009 COMPARED TO YEAR ENDED 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	(Full Year &#8211; Not Period of Ownership)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Gold production for the year ended December 31, 2009 increased by 13% to 95,502 ounces compared to 84,561 ounces produced in 2008.&#160;&#160;The increase in production for 2009 compared to 2008 was due to an increase in tonnes placed on the leach pad.&#160;&#160;Silver production for the year ended December 31, 2009 increased by 36% to 1.5 million ounces compared to 1.1 million ounces produced in 2008.&#160;&#160;This increase in silver production can be attributed to the higher silver grades mined during 2009, higher tonnes placed on the leach pad, and secondary leaching.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	for 2009 was $407 per ounce of gold compared to $399 per ounce for 2008.&#160;&#160;The increase in cash costs was a result of higher operating costs primarily from increased tonnes mined.&#160;&#160;This was partially offset by higher ounces of gold and silver, better silver prices and a weakening of the Mexican peso.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 18
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage206"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue in 2009 was $112.6 million, representing a 24% increase compared to $90.8 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;The average realized gold price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	during 2009 and 2008 were $978 and $872 per ounce, respectively, which correlates well to the average London Metals Exchange PM gold fix price of $972 and $872 per ounce, respectively.&#160;&#160;The average realized silver price
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	during 2009 and 2008 were $14.48 and $14.84 per ounce, respectively, which compares to the average London Metals Exchange silver fix price of $14.68 and $14.99 per ounce, respectively.&#160;&#160;In addition, silver sales volume increased by 375,405 ounces, while gold ounces sold increased from 85,362 in 2008 to 93,312 ounces in 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Capital expenditures for the year ended December 31, 2009 totalled $4.9 million, compared with $13.2 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;The decrease was due mainly to construction completion of leaching cells 6 and 7 during early 2009.&#160;&#160;Additionally, capital expenditures in 2008 included improvements to the production process and communications infrastructure.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IMPACT OF FOREIGN EXCHANGE ON OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Cerro San Pedro Mine was not significantly impacted by the fluctuations in the value of the Mexican peso against the U.S. dollar during the fourth quarter of 2009.&#160; The value of the Mexican peso decreased by 1% from an average of 13.26 to the U.S. dollar in the third quarter of 2009 to 13.16 to the U.S. dollar in the fourth quarter.&#160; In comparison to the fourth quarter of 2008, the value of the Mexican peso in the fourth quarter of 2009 averaged 13.16 compared to 13.04, an increase of 1%.&#160; On an annual basis, the average exchange rate for the Mexican peso increased by 21% from an average of 11.15 to 13.53 to the U.S. dollar in 2008 and 2009, respectively.&#160;&#160;This reduced total cash costs
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	but was offset by other factors described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	2010 GUIDANCE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Cerro San Pedro is forecast to produce 95,000 to 105,000 ounces of gold and 1.4 to 1.6 million ounces of silver in 2010.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	is forecast to be $390 to $410 per ounce sold, net of by-product sales.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	PEAK MINE, AUSTRALIA
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s Peak Mine is a gold and copper mining operation located in the Cobar Mineral Field near Cobar, New South Wales, Australia.&#160;&#160;The Peak Mine consists of mining and exploration licenses totaling 845 square kilometres of prospective ground covering the mining operation and mineralized extensions.&#160;&#160;The operation commenced production in 1992 and has consistently replaced annual reserve depletion over the last 18 years.&#160;&#160;With continued infill drilling to convert resources to reserves, it is expected that the mine life will be extended beyond eight years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 19
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="25%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="24%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;Three months ended December 31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="26%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;Year ended December 31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="25%" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="12%" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	&#160;2009
</FONT>
</DIV>
