<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	(1)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Realized price is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 2 at the end of this MD&amp;A.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	(2)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Total
</FONT>
	cash cost is a non-GAAP financial performance measure with no standard meaning under Canadian GAAP.&#160;&#160;See Endnote 1 at the end of this MD&amp;A.&#160;&#160;The calculation of total cash cost per ounce of gold is net of by-product copper revenue.&#160;&#160;If the copper revenue was treated as a co-product, average total cash cost at Peak Mine for the three month period ended December 31, 2009 would be $540 per ounce of gold (2008 - $414) and $1.65 per pound of copper (2008 - $0.69), and $524 per ounce of gold (2008 - $516) and for the year ended December 31, 2009, $1.34 per pound of copper (2008 - $0.74)
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	.
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FOURTH QUARTER 2009 COMPARED TO FOURTH QUARTER 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Peak Gold Mine produced 24,646 ounces of gold and 3.9 million pounds of copper during the fourth quarter of 2009, representing an 11% decrease in gold production and a 58% increase in copper production, compared to the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;Mill throughput was 2% below the operational record set in the fourth quarter of 2008.&#160;&#160;Mill feed grade was 8% lower in gold grade and 55% higher in copper grade.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenue for the fourth quarter of 2009 was higher than in the same quarter of 2008 mainly due to higher realized gold prices
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	of $1,139 per ounce compared to $788 per ounce in the same prior year period and the effect of a large copper price decrease on unpriced concentrate in the fourth quarter of 2008.&#160;&#160;Copper realized prices
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	increased from $(1.69) per pound in the fourth quarter of 2008 to $2.94 per pound in the fourth quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;The negative price per pound in the fourth quarter of 2008 reflects the price adjustment on unpriced concentrate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold in the fourth quarter of 2009 was $339 per ounce compared to $624 per ounce in the corresponding period of 2008.&#160;&#160;The decrease was primarily due to higher copper revenues which was slightly offset by a strengthening of the Australian dollar.&#160;&#160;In the fourth quarter of 2008, cash costs were higher due to an average realized price of copper of $(1.69) as a result of falling copper prices impacting the carrying value of unsold concentrate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 20
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage208"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	YEAR ENDED 2009 COMPARED TO YEAR ENDED 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Gold production was 93,247 ounces for the year ended 2009, which was 7% lower than the 100,493 ounces produced in the year ended 2008.&#160;&#160;The decrease in production was due to gold grades decreasing from 4.67 g/t in 2008 to 4.05 g/t in 2009 due to mining shifting to zones of higher copper content.&#160;&#160;This was partially offset by higher recovery rates increasing from 87% in 2008 to 90% in 2009.&#160;&#160;Gold ounces sold for 2009 were lower by 15% due to lower production and the impact of higher inventories in 2009 in comparison to the same period in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2009, copper production was 15.6 million pounds compared to 8.2 million pounds in 2008.&#160;&#160;The significant increase in copper production year-over-year was attributed to the introduction of the higher copper grade Chesney ore body.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold, net of by-product sales, for the year ended December 31, 2009 was $334 compared to $477 in the same period last year.&#160;&#160;The decrease in cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	was primarily due to higher copper revenues, and a favourable Australian dollar exchange rate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	IMPACT OF FOREIGN EXCHANGE ON OPERATIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Peak Gold Mine&#8217;s operations continue to be impacted by fluctuations in the value of the Australian dollar against the U.S. dollar.&#160;&#160;The value of the Australian dollar strengthened by 8% from an average of $1.20 to the U.S. dollar in the third quarter of 2009 to $1.10 to the U.S. dollar in the fourth quarter.&#160;&#160;This represents a negative impact on cash costs of $2.0 million, or $77 per gold ounce sold.&#160;&#160;The value of the Australian dollar in the fourth quarter of 2008 averaged $1.49 compared to $1.10 in 2009, a strengthening of 26%, resulting in a negative impact on cash costs of $4.3 million or $152 per gold ounce sold.&#160;&#160;On an annual basis, the average exchange rate for the Australian dollar weakened by 7%, from an average of $1.20 to $1.28 to the U.S. dollar in 2008 and 2009, respectively.&#160;&#160;The change in exchange rates year-to-date resulted in a positive impact on operating cost of $2.9 million, or $33 per gold ounce sold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	2010 GUIDANCE
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Peak Mines is forecast to produce 90,000 to 100,000 ounces of gold and 15 to 17 million pounds of copper in 2010.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	is forecast to be $360 to $380 per ounce sold, net of by-product sales.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	1
</FONT>
	is expected to experience an increase from 2009 levels primarily as a result of the assumed stronger Australian dollar foreign exchange rate; in Australian dollar terms operating costs are expected to remain relatively constant.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	PROJECT DEVELOPMENT REVIEW
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	AMAPARI MINE &#8211; AMAP&#193;, BRAZIL
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s 100% owned Amapari gold mine is located in the state of Amap&#225;, Brazil, approximately 130 kilometres northwest of the city of Macap&#225;, the state capital.&#160;&#160;The Amapari property consists of a mining lease and multiple exploration concessions covering approximately 2,450 square kilometres of prospective ground centering on the Company&#8217;s Amapari gold mining operation.&#160;&#160;No exploration was conducted at the Amapari operation during the fourth quarter.&#160;&#160;The Company is in the process of selling its Brazilian subsidiary Minera&#231;&#227;o Pedra Branca do Amapari (MPBA) and the Amapari Mine assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 21
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage209"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CERRO SAN PEDRO MINE, SAN LUIS POTOS&#205;, MEXICO
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the fourth quarter of 2009, the second phase of the Cerro San Pedro Sulphide (&#8220;CSP Sulphide&#8221;) drilling program concluded with the completion of an additional 17-holes totaling approximately 9,587 metres.&#160;&#160;Combined with the first phase of drilling which began in the fourth quarter of 2008, 29-holes totaling 16,829 metres have been completed under the CSP Sulphide program.&#160;&#160;The objective of the program is to test the resource potential of a zone of sulphide mineralization extending from immediately beneath the current open pit mining operation to an area of historic underground mining located approximately 500 metres to the southwest.&#160;&#160;The results of the 2009 program have been integrated into an updated geologic model and mineral resource estimate for the Cerro San Pedro Mine.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	PEAK GOLD MINE, NEW SOUTH WALES, AUSTRALIA
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the fourth quarter of 2009, the Company&#8217;s ongoing mineral resource development program at the Peak Mine&#8217;s operation resulted in the completion of 3,085 metres of exploration and delineation diamond drilling to replace mine depletion.&#160; This total includes 1,767 metres of underground drilling to delineate and explore for additional reserves in the Perseverance D deposit, and 1,318 metres of exploration drilling on a target along strike from the New Cobar mine, both of which returned positive results that will be followed-up during 2010.&#160; The Company&#8217;s regional exploration initiative at Peak Gold Mine likewise continues with surface and down-hole geophysical surveys and geochemical sampling of targets identified previously by a regional scale 3-dimensional exploration model of the Cobar Mineral Field.&#160;&#160;The best of these targets will be tested by drilling in 2010.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NEW AFTON PROJECT, BRITISH COLUMBIA, CANADA
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s New Afton copper-gold development project is located in Kamloops, British Columbia, Canada.&#160;&#160;The project is a large underground copper-gold deposit, which will produce an annual estimated average of 85,000 ounces of gold and 75 million pounds of copper over a 12-year mine life.&#160;&#160;In October, 2007, New Gold Inc. acquired from Teck Cominco Ltd., surface rights comprising approximately 4,300 acres of land surrounding the project.&#160;&#160;The property was then acquired as part of the business combination of New Gold Inc., Metallica Resources Inc. and Peak Gold Ltd., on June 30, 2008.&#160;&#160;In 2009, an underground development milestone was achieved with the breakthrough of the conveyor decline, which created a secondary access to the mine and facilitates improved equipment access.&#160;&#160;The New Afton project schedule involves continued underground development through to 2012, with undercutting of the ore body and surface construction resuming in 2011.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Project spending for 2009 was $70.2 million including cash paid interest of $19.5 million compared to $72.8 million for 2008.&#160;&#160;For 2009, the project remained on the construction schedule put in place in late 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Project spending for the fourth quarter of 2009 was $24.7 million, including cash paid interest of $10.2 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 22
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage210"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the quarter, New Afton converted its operations to four shifts working 22 hours per day, seven days per week from two shifts working 10 hours per day, four days per week, and this necessitated hiring an additional 52 employees.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Underground development advanced a total of 634 metres during the fourth quarter of 2009 compared to an advance of 453 metres during the third quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;Shotcrete support work during the period included the spraying of 1,160 cubic metres in the development headings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the fourth quarter, the pit dewatering system was drained and winterized.&#160;&#160;The pumping of water from the Afton Pit to the Pothook Pit water storage facility is scheduled to recommence in spring 2010.&#160;&#160;State of the art finite element modelling of the mine was undertaken to identify likely ground movement and subsidence.&#160;&#160;The modeling identified a requirement for additional data in some areas and subsequently a surface and underground geotechnical drilling program has commenced to address the data shortfall. Tender documents have been developed and issued for bids for the raise-boring work for the ventilation shafts, scheduled for 2010.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Major construction activities on the surface remained idle in the fourth quarter.&#160;&#160;Surface projects undertaken in the fourth quarter included: installation of temporary buried services (air, power, and water) to extend service to the upper maintenance shop; installation of a tire shop; construction of a lake water-line to supply the upper portal sumps; and, installation of lifting devices for both the upper and lower maintenance shops.&#160;&#160;New Afton also commenced installation of the permanent underground electrical substations, installed the main substation transformer in its permanent location, and installed the bull gear on to the ball mill.&#160;&#160;Project engineering work remains approximately 92% complete and is not expected to advance further until the resumption of major construction.&#160;&#160;The final draft permit applications for effluent discharge and draft air emissions remain under review by the British Columbia Ministry of Environment.&#160;&#160;The New Afton temporary water license was renewed in November at a revised rate of 3.8 L/s (previously 1.4 L/s).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	EL MORRO JOINT VENTURE, ATACAMA REGION, CHILE
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s 30% owned El Morro copper-gold project is located in the Atacama Region, Chile, approximately 80 kilometres east of the city of Vallenar.&#160;&#160;El Morro was acquired by the Company as part of the acquisition of Metallica Resources Inc. on June 30, 2009.&#160;&#160;The project is a development stage project initially managed under a shareholder agreement between Xstrata, the previous project operator and owner of a 70% interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the fourth quarter of 2009, the El Morro project activities included the continued management of the EIS application review process, which commenced in November 2008, and detailed engineering and design work for the access road and related project infrastructure by Xstrata.&#160;&#160;It is anticipated that approval of the EIS will be obtained during the first half of 2010, after which development activities can proceed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Total project expenditures from point of ownership to December 31, 2009 were $2.3 million, with no funding requirement in the fourth quarter of 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 23
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage211"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On October 12, 2009, Barrick announced that it had entered into an agreement with Xstrata to acquire Xstrata&#8217;s 70% interest in El Morro.&#160;&#160;New Gold held a right of first refusal over Xstrata&#8217;s 70% interest which was triggered when the agreement with Barrick was announced.&#160;&#160;On January 7, 2010, the Company provided notice to Xstrata of the exercise of its right of first refusal to acquire 70% of the El Morro copper-gold project in Chile for $463.0 million.&#160;&#160;The Company completed this transaction on February 16, 2010.&#160;&#160;Goldcorp loaned the $463.0 million to the Company to fund the exercise of the right of first refusal.&#160;&#160;After acquisition of the 70% interest by a subsidiary of the Company, New Gold then completed a transaction with Goldcorp which results in a Goldcorp subsidiary now holding the 70% interest in El Morro.&#160;&#160;Through the subsequent transaction with Goldcorp, the Company received $50.0 million and the terms of the shareholder agreement were amended.&#160;&#160;The Company continues to hold a 30% interest in the El Morro copper-gold project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On January 13, 2010, New Gold received a Statement of Claim filed by Barrick in the Ontario Superior Court of Justice, against New Gold, Goldcorp, and affiliated subsidiaries.&#160;&#160;The claim relates to New Gold's exercise of its right of first refusal on the El Morro copper-gold project in Chile.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold believes that the claim is completely without merit and intends to defend this action using all available legal avenues.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	REVIEW OF FINANCIAL RESULTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FOURTH QUARTER 2009 COMPARED TO FOURTH QUARTER 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Revenues increased by 259% or by $95.0 million when comparing the fourth quarter of 2009 to 2008.&#160;&#160;Although some of the increase was attributed to an increase in average realized gold prices
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	from $792 per ounce in the fourth quarter of 2008 to $1,074 per ounce in 2009, the variance was largely attributed to the acquisition of the Mesquite Mine on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;The Mesquite Mine sold 55,861 ounces of gold during the fourth quarter of 2009, for which there is no prior year comparative contribution.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating expenses increased from $44.2 million in 2008 to $67.4 million in the fourth quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;The addition of the Mesquite Mine to the Company&#8217;s operating mines contributed $30.7 million to operating expenses.&#160;&#160;Overall, the Company&#8217;s operating costs remain relatively high due to high consumables prices and maintenance activities.&#160;&#160;The acquisition of Metallica Resources Inc. in 2008 resulted in the net assets being recorded at fair values.&#160;&#160;These fair value adjustments included an increase in inventory of $18.3 million, all of which was recorded as an operating expense during the period ended December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The acquisition of Western Goldfields in 2009 resulted in a fair value adjustment to increase inventory by $2.5 million, all of which was recorded as an operating expense during the period ended December 31, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The increase in depreciation and depletion of $17.5 million to $24.7 million in the fourth quarter of 2009 was primarily attributed to the addition of the Mesquite Mine to the Company&#8217;s operating mine portfolio on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;For the fourth quarter of 2009, the Mesquite Mine incurred depreciation and depletion expense of $9.2 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 24
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage212"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the three months ended December 31, 2009, New Gold had earnings from mine operations of $39.7 million compared with a loss of $14.6 million in the same prior year period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Corporate administration costs of $9.4 million in the fourth quarter of 2009 were 27% higher than the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;Corporate administration was higher in the fourth quarter of 2009 primarily due to employee bonus accruals and increased professional services fees as a result of mining disruption at our Cerro San Pedro Mine.&#160;&#160;Stock-based compensation costs included within corporate administration was $1.8 million and $1.3 million in fourth quarters of 2009 and 2008, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Exploration costs of $1.3 million in the fourth quarter of 2009 were slightly higher than $0.9 million for the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;The majority of drilling at Peak Mines for the year was completed by the third quarter of 2008, whereas minor delays caused drilling to continue into the fourth quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;&#160;In 2009, exploration work was focused on the Cerro San Pedro Sulphide drilling program, which commenced in November 2008 and was completed by the end of the third quarter of 2009.&#160;&#160;As a result, exploration for the fourth quarter was lower than the third quarter of 2009 by $1.1 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On July 1, 2009, the Company met the criteria for hedge accounting under the Canadian Institute of Chartered Accountants&#8217; Handbook section 3865 &#8211;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Hedges
</FONT>
	in accounting for its gold hedge and fuel contracts.&#160;&#160;Application of the accounting standards allows the Company to record realized gains and losses on gold hedge settlements within revenue.&#160;&#160;For settlements on the fuel hedges, the realized gains and losses are classified within operating expenses.&#160;&#160;Changes resulting from the mark-to-market of the gold hedge and fuel contracts are now recognized within other comprehensive income.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the three month period ended December 31, 2009, the Company&#8217;s Mesquite Mine realized losses of $2.1 million within revenues for settlement of three months of gold hedge contracts totaling 16,500 ounces.&#160;&#160;The Mesquite Mine realized no gains or losses on the settlement of fourth quarter fuel hedge contracts totaling 756,000 gallons of diesel fuel.&#160;&#160;As a result of the increase in the spot price of gold from $996 per ounce to $1,088 per ounce between September 30 and December 31, 2009, the Mesquite Mine recognized $22.3 million of pre-tax unrealized losses in the mark-to-market of remaining contracts within other comprehensive income.&#160;&#160;Due to credit conditions, the Company revised the credit adjusted rate that it uses to value gold sales forward hedging contracts.&#160;&#160;This resulted in the gold hedge having no ineffectiveness at December 31, 2009 and the reversal of a previously recorded net unrealized loss of $0.9 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the fourth quarter of 2009, the Company earned interest and other income of $1.4million compared to $0.3 million earned in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;Although interest rates were unchanged year-over-year, the Company held cash balances of $262.3 million at December 31, 2009, up from $182.0 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;The remaining difference was attributed to miscellaneous income items.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company recognized foreign exchange losses of $11.2 million in the fourth quarter of 2009 compared to a gain of $54.0 million in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2009, the U.S. dollar continued to weaken against foreign currencies as a result of the relative weakness of the US economy.&#160;&#160;Both the Canadian and Australian dollars strengthened significantly against the U.S. dollar, partly as a result of stronger energy and commodity prices, as both countries are large net exporters of energy and commodities.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;In the fourth quarter of 2009, the revaluation of monetary assets and liabilities resulted in a loss on foreign exchange of $11.2 million.&#160;&#160;In the fourth quarter of 2008, the Company recorded a $54.0 million foreign exchange gain as a result of the strengthening of the U.S. dollar compared to the Mexican peso, Australian dollar, and Canadian dollar.&#160;&#160;The majority of the gain arose due to the revaluation of monetary assets and liabilities and future income tax liabilities recorded on the business combination between New Gold, Metallica, and Peak Gold.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 25
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income and mining tax expense in the fourth quarter of 2009 was $4.5 million compared to a recovery of $8.5 million in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;The change was a result of an increase in the future enacted tax rate in Mexico and overall increase in taxable income for certain mining operations of the Company.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On January 2, 2009, the Amapari gold mining operation was placed on care and maintenance due to the depletion of ore that would be economically minable with the current crushing and conventional heap leaching operation.&#160;&#160;Since that point in time, the Amapari Mine has been recovering gold ounces from the residual heap leaching operation.&#160;&#160;On January 27, 2010 the Company announced that it had found a buyer for the Amapari Mine and management has therefore determined this to be a discontinued operation from a financial reporting perspective.&#160;&#160;The Amapari Mine recognized a net loss of $5.4 million from discontinued operations for the three months ended December 31, 2009, mainly attributed to care and maintenance activities and additional provisioning for legal claims.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the three months ended December 31, 2009, New Gold had a net loss from continuing operations of $2.3 million, or $0.01 per basic and diluted share.&#160;&#160;This compares with net earnings from continuing operations of $39.4 million, or $0.18 per basic and diluted share in the same prior year period.&#160;&#160;In the fourth quarter of 2009, net loss, including loss from discontinued operations, was $7.7 million, or $0.02 per basic and diluted share.&#160;&#160;This compares with net income of $41.1 million, or $0.19 per basic and diluted share in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	2009 COMPARED TO 2008
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2009, New Gold earned revenues of $323.8 million, which compares favourably to the $143.1 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company added the Mesquite Mine to its existing portfolio of operating mines on May 27, 2009, which contributed $94.5 million in revenues since acquisition.&#160;&#160;In addition, the first two quarters of 2008 did not include the results of the Cerro San Pedro Mine as it was acquired on June 30, 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company recognized average realized gold prices
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(2)
</FONT>
	of $983 per ounce in 2009 compared to $863 per ounce in 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company also sold 292,407 ounces in 2009 compared to 237,590 in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Operating expenses for the 12 months ended December 31, 2009 were $176.5 million, which represented a 71% increase over the prior year balance.&#160;&#160;The 2008 figures were not representative of the full year operating results as the first two quarters in 2008 did not include the operating results of the Cerro San Pedro Mine.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Mesquite Mine was acquired on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;Therefore, the year ended 2009 includes a full 12 months of operation for the Cerro San Pedro and Peak Mines, and seven months from the Mesquite Mine.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold decreased from $566 per ounce in 2008 to $465 per ounce in 2009.&#160;&#160;Total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per gold ounce sold figures for previous periods have been restated as a result of reclassification of costs between operating costs and depreciation and depletion for the Cerro San Pedro Mine.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 26
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage214"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of the additions of the Cerro San Pedro Mine and Mesquite Mine, depreciation and depletion increased from $18.6 million to $58.7 million from 2008 to 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2009, New Gold had earnings from mine operations of $88.6 million compared with $21.4 million in the same prior year period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Corporate administration increased marginally from $22.4 million in 2008 to $24.7 million in 2009.&#160;&#160;The increment is explained by the acquisition of Western Goldfields on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;These figures include stock-based compensation of $6.6 million in 2009 and $7.0 million in the same prior year period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Business combination transaction costs of $6.6 million in 2009 represented professional services fees incurred in relation to the acquisition of Western Goldfields and consisted of expenditures for legal, financial advisory, and other due diligence costs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Exploration costs increased from $4.0 million in 2008 to $6.4 million in 2009.&#160;&#160;In 2009, exploration focused on the Cerro San Pedro Sulphide drilling program and drilling at the Liberty Bell project.&#160;&#160;There was no drilling at Liberty Bell in 2008.&#160;&#160;In 2008, exploration was on drilling activities at the New Cobar and New Occidental areas at the Peak Mine.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In 2009, the Company recorded goodwill related to the acquisition of Western Goldfields of $192.1 million.&#160;&#160;The goodwill was allocated entirely to the Mesquite Mine as it was the only reporting unit acquired pursuant to the Western Goldfields business combination.&#160;&#160;The net asset value of the Mesquite Mine consists of plant and equipment and mining properties.&#160;&#160;Plant and equipment were valued using an independent third party valuator.&#160;&#160;Mining properties were valued using the discounted cash flow of:&#160;&#160;&#160;proven and probable reserves; measured, indicated, and inferred resources.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company valued the sulphide potential using prices paid for similar market transactions.&#160;&#160;During 2009, the Company determined it could not support the carrying value of the goodwill and therefore recorded a full impairment charge on the $192.1 million.&#160;&#160;$138.1 million of goodwill resulted from using the court approval date of May 27, 2009 as the acquisition date, as opposed to the business combination announcement date of March 4, 2009.&#160;&#160;In preparation of New Gold&#8217;s financial statements, management elected to early adopt CICA Handbook Section 1582
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Business Combinations
</FONT>
	which requires the measurement date to be the date equity instruments are exchanged in a business combination, in this case being May 27, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On July 1, 2009, the Company&#8217;s gold hedge contracts and fuel hedge contracts qualified for hedge accounting.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the monthly settlement of the gold hedge and fuel contracts results in a realized gain or loss which is recorded with the underlying derivative instrument.&#160;&#160;For gold contracts, realized losses from the settlement of third and fourth quarter gold hedges of $3.4 million were recorded within revenues; fuel settlement losses in the third and fourth quarters of $0.1 million were recorded within operating costs.&#160;&#160;The mark-to-market of the fuel and hedge contracts, net of tax, resulted in other comprehensive loss of $45.7 million for the year ended December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;Interest and other income of $4.9 million was 9% lower in 2009 than in 2008 as a result of interest rates remaining at historically low levels.&#160;&#160;The equity financing which closed on September 11, 2009 resulted in a cash inflow of $107.2 million but had minimal impact on interest income.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 27
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage215"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In 2009, the Company recognized a loss on foreign exchange of $52.7 million due to the weakening of the U.S. dollar against the Canadian dollar, Mexican peso and Australian dollar.&#160;&#160;During 2009, the Canadian dollar strengthened by 14% against the U.S. dollar.&#160;&#160;The revaluation of Canadian dollar denominated monetary items to U.S. dollars resulted in a $22.9 million foreign exchange loss which included the revaluation of future income tax liabilities at the New Afton Mine.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Australian dollar and Mexican peso strengthened in value against the U.S. dollar by 23% and 5%, respectively.&#160;&#160;The revaluation of future income tax liabilities at the Peak and Cerro San Pedro Mines resulted in a combined foreign exchange loss of $29.8 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Income and mining tax expense in 2009 was $14.9 million compared to a recovery of $3.3 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;The change was primarily attributable to the Cerro San Pedro Mine becoming fully taxable during 2009 and the increase in the enacted future tax rate in Mexico.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December 31, 2009, the financial position and operations of the Amapari Mine have been presented as a discontinued operation.&#160;&#160;The Company has an agreement in place to sell the property and thus segregated all results separately from activities relating to continuing operations.&#160;&#160;Since placing the Amapari Mine on care and maintenance in early 2009, the Company was only able to recover and sell gold ounces from the residual heap leach operations.&#160;&#160;For the year ended December 31, 2009, a loss of $10.9 million was realized on this discontinued operation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For the year ended December 31, 2009, New Gold had a net loss from continuing operations of $183.4 million, or $0.60 per basic and diluted share.&#160;&#160;This compares with a net income from continuing operations of $70.9 million, or $0.48 per basic and diluted share, in 2008.&#160;&#160;In 2009, net loss, including loss from discontinued operations, was $194.3 million, or $0.64 per basic and diluted share.&#160;&#160;This compares with a net loss of $102.7 million, or $0.69 per basic and diluted share in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	BALANCE SHEET REVIEW
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	ASSETS
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December 31, 2009, New Gold held cash and cash equivalents of $262.3 million.&#160;&#160;This compares favourably with the $182.0 million held at December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The December 31, 2009 balance includes $107.2 million of gross proceeds from an equity financing completed on September 11, 2009.&#160;&#160;Of the Company&#8217;s holdings, $114.1 million is held in Canadian federal and provincial treasury bills and $85.0 million in cash.&#160;&#160;The remainder is held in the following liquid forms:&#160;&#160;banker&#8217;s acceptances, term deposits, and guaranteed investment certificates.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s cash and cash equivalents balance excludes the $9.2 million of restricted cash held as part of the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s term loan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s inventory and stockpiled ore balance has increased by four times the balance at December 31, 2008 to $86.3 million at December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;The addition of the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s heap leach operations to New Gold&#8217;s operating mine portfolio contributed to the heap leach ore inventory of $58.2 million at December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;The Mesquite Mine accounted for $36.2 million of this balance.&#160;&#160;Other significant components of inventories included: $13.9 million of work-in-process, $9.4 million of supplies inventory, and $4.8 million of finished goods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold owns $99.4 million (Cdn$104.0 million) of face value long-term asset backed notes.&#160;&#160;These AB Notes were issued as replacement of asset backed commercial paper formerly held by the Company.&#160;&#160;During the fourth quarter of 2009, the company disposed of Cdn$56.3 million of face value AB Notes for total proceeds of $29.8 million (Cdn$31.2 million).&#160;&#160;MAV 2 Class A-1 and MAV 2 Class A-2 notes were disposed at 58% and 46%, respectively, of the face value.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The Company has estimated the fair value of the AB Notes at December 31, 2009 at $45.9 million (Cdn$48.0 million).&#160;&#160;The estimate of fair value is based on the last transaction price of the potential sale of the MAV 2 A-1 and A-2 asset backed notes in December 2009 and current bid prices received from dealers and brokers for the other remaining notes, with MAV 2 Class B notes valued at 9% of face value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mining interests increased by 24% to $2.0 billion at December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;Most of this increase was attributed to the acquisition of Western Goldfields on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;The calculated purchase consideration of $397.4 million resulted in goodwill of $192.1 million.&#160;&#160;$138.1 million of goodwill resulted from using the court approval date of May 27, 2009 as the acquisition date, as opposed to the business combination announcement date of March 4, 2009.&#160;&#160;In preparation of New Gold&#8217;s financial statements, management elected to early adopt CICA Handbook Section 1582
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Business Combinations
</FONT>
	which requires the measurement date to be the date equity instruments are exchanged in a business combination, in this case being May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;Management evaluated the goodwill for impairment and determined that it could not support the carrying value and therefore, wrote down the entire goodwill amount of $192.1 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 29
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
