<A NAME="eolPage217"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	ASSET BACKED NOTES
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	At December 31, 2009, the Company owned long-term asset backed notes with a face value of $99.4 million (Cdn$104.0 million).&#160;&#160;These AB Notes were issued in replacement of asset backed commercial paper (&#8220;ABCP&#8221;) formerly held by the Company.&#160;&#160;When the ABCP matured but was not redeemed in 2007, it became the subject of a restructuring process that replaced the ABCP with long-term asset backed securities.&#160;&#160;The restructuring was completed and the AB Notes were issued on January 21, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The ABCP were acquired as part of the business combination between New Gold Inc., Metallica Resources Inc. and Peak Gold Ltd. on June 30, 2008.&#160; At that time, the fair value of the ABCP was Cdn$92.9 million representing approximately Cdn$0.54 per dollar of original face value.&#160; During 2009 and 2010, the Company sold all of its holdings in MAV 2 Class A-1, A-2, and 15 notes for a weighted average realized price of Cdn$0.58 per dollar, and received Cdn$9.4 million as a return of capital on the MAV 3 Class 9 notes, representing&#160;&#160;99% of the original principal.&#160; Overall, the Company has achieved to-date a weighted average realized price of Cdn$0.64 per dollar compared to the original portfolio value of Cdn$0.54 per dollar at the business combination date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the fourth quarter of 2009 Cdn$56.3 million of face value AB Notes were sold for cash proceeds of Cdn$31.2 million.&#160;&#160;Three classes of AB Notes were sold: Cdn$32.9 million MAV 2 Class A-1 notes for Cdn$19.1 million; Cdn$18.3 million MAV 2 Class A-2 notes for Cdn$8.4 million; and Cdn$5.1 million MAV 2 Class 15 notes for Cdn$3.7 million. New Gold was able to realize a weighted average price of Cdn$0.55 per dollar through the monetization of this portion of the AB Notes during the fourth quarter.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition, during the first quarter of 2010 the Company&#8217;s remaining MAV 2 Class A-1 notes and MAV 2 Class A-2 notes were divested: Cdn$69.8 million MAV 2 A-1 for Cdn$43.4 million; and Cdn$13.3 million MAV 2 A-2 for Cdn$6.5 million.&#160;&#160;New Gold was able to realize a weighted average price of Cdn$0.60 per dollar through the monetization of this portion of the AB Notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has estimated the fair value of the remaining AB Notes at December 31, 2009 using the following methodology and assumptions:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" FACE="WINGDINGS">
	&#167;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Where the Company still retains AB Notes of the same class as were sold in the fourth quarter, the retained AB Notes are valued at the last transaction price of the partial sale in December 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 30
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage218"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" FACE="WINGDINGS">
	&#167;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The other remaining notes, with a face value of $20.0 million (Cdn$20.9 million) and fair value of less than $0.7 million (Cdn$0.8 million), are valued at market bid prices provided by banks and traders active in the AB Notes market.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of this analysis, the Company has estimated the fair market value of its AB Notes investment to be $45.9 million as at December 31, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	While the Company believes that it has utilized an appropriate methodology to estimate fair value, given the current state and ongoing volatility of global credit markets, there can be no assurance that management&#8217;s estimate of potential recovery as at December 31, 2009 is accurate.&#160;&#160;Subsequent adjustments, either materially higher or lower, may be required in future reporting periods.&#160;&#160;The Company will continue to aggressively manage the process to recover the maximum value from the original investments and interest due.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The secondary market for the Company&#8217;s remaining AB Notes (after the first quarter 2010 divestitures) is relatively illiquid, however management will continue to monitor developments in order to maximize value.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FUEL CONTRACTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold&#8217;s wholly-owned subsidiary, Western Mesquite Mines Inc. (&#8220;WMM&#8221;), entered into fuel hedge contracts with financial institutions in December 2008 and January 2009.&#160;&#160;The hedging contracts represent a total commitment of 2.9 million and 3.0 million gallons of diesel per year at weighted average prices of $1.75 and $1.94 per gallon in 2009 and 2010, respectively.&#160;&#160;New Gold assumed the liability upon acquisition of Western Goldfields on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;The Company is financially settling 252,000 gallons of diesel per month related to these contracts until December 31, 2010.&#160;&#160;As at December 31, 2009, 3.0 million gallons remain to be settled.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s fuel hedge contracts did not initially meet the criterion in Section 3865
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Hedges
</FONT>
	, and therefore were not designated as cash flow hedges.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, period-end mark-to-market adjustments related to these contracts were immediately reflected on the statement of operations of the Company as unrealized gains or losses on fuel hedging contracts and the cumulative effect was reflected as an asset or liability on the balance sheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On July 1, 2009, the Company&#8217;s fuel contracts met the requirements under Section 3865
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Hedges
</FONT>
	and were therefore designated as cash flow hedges against forecasted purchases of fuel for expected consumption at the Mesquite Mine.&#160;&#160;Prospective and retrospective hedge effectiveness is assessed using the hypothetical derivative method.&#160;&#160;The prospective test is based on regression analysis of the month-on-month change in fair value of both the actual derivative and a hypothetical derivative caused by actual historic changes in commodity prices over prior periods.&#160;&#160;The retrospective test involves comparing the effect of historic changes in fuel prices each period on the fair value of both the actual and hypothetical derivative using a hypothetical derivative method.&#160;&#160;The effective portion of changes in fair value of the commodity contracts is recorded in other comprehensive income (&#8220;OCI&#8221;) until the forecasted transaction impacts earnings.&#160;&#160;Where applicable, the fair value of the derivative has been evaluated to account for the Company&#8217;s credit risk.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 31
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage219"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	There were no realized gains or losses recognized for the three month period ended December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;The remaining contracts were marked-to-market as at December 31, 2009, resulting in a pre-tax adjustment to OCI of $0.2 million.&#160;&#160;The cumulative fuel hedge asset as at December 31, 2009 was $0.7 million.&#160;&#160;Since changes in the hypothetical derivative were less than the actual derivative, the Company did not recognize any ineffective hedge amounts for the three month period ended December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;The twelve months unrealized gain on the fuel hedge contracts of $0.8 million was a result of mark-to-market adjustments prior to qualifying for hedge accounting.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	D.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	GOLD HEDGE CONTRACTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Under the terms of the term loan facility entered into by WMM, as a condition precedent to drawdown the loan, WMM entered into a gold hedging program acceptable to the banking syndicate.&#160;&#160;As such, at the time of the agreement, the Company had executed gold forward sales contracts for 429,000 ounces of gold at a price of $801 per ounce.&#160;&#160;New Gold assumed the liability upon acquisition of Western Goldfields on May 27, 2009.&#160;&#160;As at December 31, 2009, the remaining gold contracts represent a commitment of 5,500 ounces per month for 60 months with the last commitment deliverable in December 2014 for a total of 330,000 ounces.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s gold hedge contracts did not initially meet the criterion in Section 3865
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Hedges
</FONT>
	, and therefore were not designated as cash flow hedges.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the period-end mark-to-market adjustments related to these contracts were immediately reflected on the statement of operations of the Company as unrealized gains or losses on gold forward sales contracts and the cumulative effect was reflected as an asset or liability on the balance sheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	On July 1, 2009, the Company&#8217;s gold hedging contracts met the requirements for cash flow hedges under Section 3865
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Hedges
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;Prospective hedge effectiveness is assessed on these hedges using the hypothetical derivative method.&#160;&#160;The hypothetical derivative assessment involves comparing the effect of theoretical shifts in forward gold prices on the fair value of both the actual hedging derivative and a hypothetical derivative.&#160;&#160;The retrospective assessment involves comparing the effect of historic changes in gold prices each period on the fair value of both the actual and hypothetical derivative.&#160;&#160;The effective portion of the gold contracts is recorded in OCI until the forecasted gold sale impacts earnings.&#160;&#160;Where applicable, the fair value of the derivative has been evaluated to account for the Company&#8217;s credit risk.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The remaining contracts were marked-to-market as at December 31, 2009, resulting in a cumulative unrealized pre-tax loss of $96.0 million that has been disclosed as a liability and a pre-tax adjustment of $45.7 million to OCI.&#160;&#160;The unrealized gain for the year ended December 31, 2009 was $8.2 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	E.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	LONG-TERM DEBT
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The majority of the Company&#8217;s contractual obligations consist of long-term debt and interest payable.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009, the Company held $237.5 million in long-term debt.&#160;&#160;Of this balance, $169.0 million was held in senior secured notes that mature and become due and payable on June 28, 2017.&#160;&#160;These notes bear interest at a rate of 10% per annum and is payable in arrears in equal semi-annual installments.&#160;&#160;During the first quarter of 2009, the Company acquired Cdn$50.0 million face value of its senior secured notes for consideration of Cdn$30.0 million from the noteholders.&#160;&#160;This results in a reduction of approximately Cdn$5.0 million per year in interest payments.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Company holds through the Mesquite Mine, $27.2 million in a term loan facility with an amended repayment schedule up to June 30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The term loan facility was used to fund development of the Mesquite Mine which is now in full operation.&#160;&#160;Interest on this loan is now being charged at U.S. dollar LIBOR plus 4.25%.&#160;&#160;The term loan facility was fully repaid on February 26, 2010.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 32
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage220"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Long-term debt obligations are comprised of senior secured notes, subordinated convertible debentures and the Mesquite Mine term loan facility.&#160;&#160;The senior secured notes (&#8220;Notes&#8221;), which were originally issued by New Gold pursuant to a note indenture dated June 28, 2007, mature and become payable on June 28, 2017 and bear interest at a rate of 10% per annum.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009 the face value of the Notes totalled $178.7 million (Cdn$187.0 million).&#160;&#160;Interest is payable in arrears in equal semi-annual installments on January 1 and July 1 each year.&#160;&#160;Once the New Afton Project is in commercial production, the Company will be obligated to offer to repay a face value amount equal to 50% of excess cash flow each year, at the option of the note holders.&#160;&#160;The Company also has the option to prepay the Notes at a price ranging from 120% to 100% (decreasing rates based on the length of time the Notes are outstanding).&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009 the redemption price was 114% and is scheduled to decrease to 110% on June 28, 2010.&#160;&#160;These Notes are secured on the New Afton Project assets.&#160;&#160;Capitalized interest relating to the Notes was $16.5 million in 2009, and $9.5 million in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has 55,000 subordinated convertible debentures (&#8220;Debentures&#8221;) that bear interest at a rate of 5% per annum and are convertible by the holders into common shares of the Company at any time up to June 28, 2014 at a conversion price of Cdn$9.35 per share.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009, the aggregate principal of the Debentures was $52.6 million (Cdn$55.0 million).&#160;&#160;The Debentures are accounted for as compound financial instruments comprised of a liability and an equity component.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009, the carrying amount of the liability of $37.6 million will be accreted to the face value of the Debentures over their term to maturity.&#160;&#160;Interest is payable in arrears in equal semi-annual installments on January 1 and July 1 each year.&#160;&#160;Capitalized interest relating to the Debentures was $4.6 million in 2009, and $1.1 million in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold&#8217;s wholly-owned subsidiary Western Goldfields Inc., had a term loan facility with a syndicate of banks under which $86.3 million was borrowed in connection with the development of the Mesquite Mine.&#160;&#160;The facility is secured by all of the assets of WMM and a pledge of the shares of WMM owned by the Company.&#160;&#160;The loan was assumed upon completion of the Western Goldfields acquisition on May 27, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Repayment of the project facility is on a semi-annual basis, from December 31, 2008 through June 30, 2012 according to an agreed schedule of percentages of the loan outstanding on October 7, 2009 when an amendment was approved.&#160;&#160;In addition to the scheduled repayments, mandatory prepayments are required semi-annually based on 50% of the excess cash flows from the Mesquite Mine.&#160;&#160;Once the loan is repaid it cannot be redrawn.&#160;&#160;Interest on the amended term loan facility is charged at U.S. dollar LIBOR plus 4.25%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 33
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage221"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2009, the Company had drawn $86.3 million less repayments of $59.1 million under the facility, and incurred interest at an average rate of approximately 5.25% for the three month period.&#160;&#160;At May 27, 2009, the outstanding loan balance was $68.6 million.&#160;&#160;Since then, the Company made combined repayments and prepayments totaling $41.4 million, leaving the balance outstanding on the term loan facility at $27.2 million as at December 31, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The gold hedge now extends two and a half years beyond the revised loan term to December 31, 2014. 165,000 ounces of gold, or approximately half of the program, are hedged beyond June 30, 2012 and may be monetized by the Company at its option.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The remaining loan balance was fully repaid on February 26, 2010 and permits the Company the flexibility to monetize the remaining hedges outstanding at its discretion.&#160;&#160;The Company currently has no plans to monetize the remaining gold hedge contracts.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	F.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	FUTURE INCOME AND MINING TAXES
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The net future income tax liability increased from $221.4 million in 2008 to $305.3 million in 2009.&#160;&#160;The change was primarily attributed to the following factors:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" FACE="WINGDINGS">
	&#167;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The business combination with Western Goldfields resulted in the recognition of a $90.3 million future income tax liability associated with the recognition of an increase in fair value from the book value related to the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s mineral properties.&#160;&#160;This future income tax liability was offset by $52.1 million of future income tax assets, primarily associated with loss pools that are available to shelter future taxable income.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" FACE="WINGDINGS">
	&#167;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company recognized foreign exchange losses associated with future income tax balances of $37.0 million related to the weakening of the U.S. dollar against other foreign currencies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" FACE="WINGDINGS">
	&#167;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Mexican statutory income tax rate increased from 28% to 30% in the beginning of 2010, resulting in a $7.8 million increase in the future income tax liability originally recognized on the acquisition of the Cerro San Pedro Mine in 2008.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The current income tax liability increased from $5.1 million in 2008 to $15.7 million in 2009.&#160;&#160;The change is primarily attributable to a $4.5 million increase in Mexican taxes payable due to higher profitability and the use of remaining Mexican tax losses during fiscal 2009 resulting in the Cerro San Pedro Mine&#8217;s operations being fully cash taxable.&#160;&#160;In addition, there is a $2.9 million current income liability owing to U.S. taxation authorities for the Mesquite Mine that did not exist in 2008.&#160;&#160;The liability primarily arises from the State of California implementing a suspension on the utilization of corporate tax losses to reduce taxable income in 2009 as part of measures to address the state&#8217;s budget shortfall.&#160;&#160;&#160;The remaining increase in current income tax liability was associated with higher profitability in Australia and an increase in other tax reserves.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	NON-GAAP MEASURE &#8211; TOTAL CASH COST
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	PER GOLD OUNCE CALCULATION
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold reports total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	on a sales basis.&#160;&#160;In the gold mining industry, this is a common performance measure but does not have any standardized meaning, and is a non-GAAP measure.&#160;&#160;The Company follows the recommendations of the Gold Institute Standard.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that, in addition to conventional measures prepared in accordance with GAAP, certain investors use this information to evaluate the Company&#8217;s performance and ability to generate cash flow.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, it is intended to provide additional information and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP.&#160;&#160;The following table provides a reconciliation of total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	per ounce of gold sold to the financial statements:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2009, the Company had cash and cash equivalents held by continuing operations of $262.3 million compared to $242.6 million at September 30, 2009.&#160;&#160;These balances exclude $9.2 million of restricted cash held by the Mesquite Mine as part of requirements in its term loan agreement ($7.5 million at September 30, 2009), and exclude $6.2 million and $9.0 million of reclamation deposits for the New Afton project and Mesquite Mine, respectively.&#160;&#160;The increase in cash in the three month period was attributed to the following key items:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Interest paid on senior secured notes and convertible debentures of $10.2 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT" FACE="WINGDINGS">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 35
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage223"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s cash and cash equivalents are invested in highly liquid, low risk, interest-bearing investments with maturities of 90 days or less from the original date of investment.&#160;&#160;The surplus corporate funds are only invested with approved government or bank counterparties.&#160;&#160;This does not include the AB Notes (refer to AB Notes section in
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates
</FONT>
	for further discussion).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2009, the Company had working capital from continuing operations of $301.7 million.&#160;&#160;During the quarter, the Company&#8217;s working capital increased by the sources of cash described above and was negatively impacted by a $19.3 million decrease in the current portion of long-term debt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the opinion of management, the working capital at December 31, 2009, together with cash flows from operations, are sufficient to support the Company&#8217;s normal operating requirements on an ongoing basis.&#160;&#160;However, taking into consideration volatile equity markets, global uncertainty in the capital markets and increasing cost pressures, the Company is continually reviewing expenditures in order to ensure adequate liquidity and flexibility to support its growth strategy while maintaining or increasing production levels at its current operations.&#160;&#160;At current metal prices, it is expected that the Company&#8217;s existing assets coupled with the cash flow from current operations will be sufficient to fund the construction of the New Afton project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the year ended December 31, 2009, the Company had positive operating cash flows from continuing operations of $79.0 million and invested a total of $111.5 million in mining interests, including $1.3 million at the Mesquite Mine, $3.2 million at the Cerro San Pedro Mine, $28.6 million at the Peak Mine, $76.2 at the New Afton Project and $2.2 million at other projects.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES OUTLOOK
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s future profits and cash position are highly dependent on metal prices, including gold, silver and copper.&#160;&#160;Copper will become increasingly important when the New Afton and El Morro Projects are currently expected to be completed after 2011.&#160;&#160;&#160;In addition to these internal growth opportunities, the Company has other prospective properties which include, but are not limited to, CSP Sulphide, the Abacus joint venture at New Afton and Liberty Bell in Alaska.&#160;&#160;Internal growth will focus on the New Afton and El Morro Projects; however there are other potential development properties that may become high priorities as further exploration and assessment is completed.&#160;&#160;In order to supplement this internal growth, the Company considers expansion opportunities through mergers and acquisitions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Capital expenditures for 2010 are expected to be approximately $180.4 million with $14.6 million allocated to the Mesquite Mine, $10.8 million to the Cerro San Pedro Mine, $31.9 million to Peak Mine, $119.9 million (including capitalized interest) to the continued development of New Afton, and $3.2 million for corporate expenditures.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Management believes the Company will not need external financing to complete its major development projects. The recently closed transaction with Goldcorp on the El Morro project will eliminate the need for project capital.&#160;&#160;With the successful business combination with Western Goldfields Inc., the sale of the AB Notes, the El Morro transaction with Goldcorp, the expected completion of the sale of the Amapari Mine, and current and forecast metal prices, it is expected that the Company&#8217;s existing assets coupled with the cash flow from current operations will be sufficient to fully fund the construction of the New Afton and El Morro projects.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 36
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage224"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company expects it will not need external financing to repay its remaining debt in 2014 and 2017.&#160;&#160;These statements are based on the current financial position of the Company and are subject to change if any acquisitions or external growth opportunities are realized.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	OUTLOOK
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Global growth is returning and the broader economy is more optimistic and firmly moving towards recovery after a challenging period in the early part of 2009.&#160;&#160;The fourth quarter of 2009 has continued with stabilization of economic and credit conditions.&#160;&#160;To date, the recovery has been supported by significant government stimulus, however consumer demand has been choppy at best.&#160;&#160;China and other emerging economies have led the way, supporting higher energy and commodity prices.&#160;&#160;In contrast, the U.S., many European nations and Japan have lagged to date due to high unemployment, low consumer confidence and persisting weakness in many sectors, such as housing.&#160;&#160;We believe the next one to two years will show a return to a more coordinated global growth phase with moderate inflation, however there may be increased risks related to high government debt levels and geopolitical issues.&#160;&#160;Key risks to future growth include fading government fiscal and monetary support, above average unemployment, increasing interest rates and geopolitical issues, such as unstable oil supplies from countries including Iraq, Nigeria and Angola.&#160;&#160;If unprecedented government spending and low interest rates start to subside as expected in the second half of 2010, there is a risk of weaker economic recovery or even a relapse into recession.&#160;&#160;However, economists believe the most likely outcome may be a more volatile return to sustained growth rather than another recession.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The recovery in the global economy and stock markets seen during 2009 has also continued to support base metal prices during the fourth quarter, including copper which has increased from $2.79 per pound at the end of September 2009, to an average of $3.02 per pound during the quarter ended December 31, 2009, and ended at $3.33 per pound.&#160;&#160;In addition, gold and silver prices have increased from the September 30, 2009 closing prices of $996 per ounce and $16.45 per ounce to $1,096 and $16.85, respectively, at the end of December 2009.&#160;&#160;The average gold and silver prices for the fourth quarter were $1,100 and $17.57 per ounce, respectively.&#160;&#160;The average gold, silver and copper prices for the year ended December 31, 2009 were $972 per ounce, $14.68 per ounce, and $2.35 per pound respectively compared to the year ended December 31, 2008 when prices averaged $872 per ounce, $14.99 per ounce, and $3.16 per pound.&#160;&#160;Key factors influencing the price of gold include currency rate fluctuations and the relative strength of the U.S. dollar, the supply of, and demand for, gold and macroeconomic factors such as the level of interest rates and inflation expectations.&#160;&#160;Economists are currently predicting continued weakening of the U.S. dollar over the next one to two years, and we believe commodity based currencies, such as the Australian and Canadian dollars, will appreciate relative to the U.S. dollar.&#160;&#160;Market conditions and potential earlier interest rate increases may keep these currencies at parity or above in the near term, particularly if central banks diversify their reserves away from the U.S. dollar.&#160;&#160;In addition, global investors may look to diversify away from U.S. dollar assets accumulated during the recent financial difficulties.&#160;&#160;Investors are seeking higher yields in riskier assets, fuelling further carry-trade activity resulting in borrowings in U.S. dollars and investments in other higher yielding currencies and assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 37
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="5">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage225"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Global liquidity, improving economic fundamentals and a weaker U.S dollar should support gold and silver prices in the near term.&#160;&#160;Forecasting metal prices and demand has been difficult, however, in light of recent signs of the strengthening of markets, management believes the long term environment and prospects for our business are favourable.&#160;&#160;We have not hedged foreign exchange rates and metal prices, except to meet the lenders&#8217; requirements related to the Mesquite Mine&#8217;s term loan facility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition to the above factors, we believe the outlook for global gold mine production continues to be one of declining supply due to limited global exploration success, a trend of lower grade production by producers, a lack of promising regions for gold exploration and production, and challenges in bringing projects to the production stage.&#160;&#160;The significant market interest, including from two of the largest gold companies in the world, in the El Morro copper-gold project is further evidence of the limited pure gold projects of significant size available to support demand and ambitious growth plans of any scale.&#160;&#160;We believe long term gold prices will benefit from these trends and copper will also be supported by potential under-investment in new capacity during the last cycle.&#160;&#160;Some industry observers believe new mine development will be needed by 2012, which coincides well with the expected timing of commercial production at the New Afton project in mid-2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	These signs of recovery have also supported an improvement in general corporate credit market conditions during 2009 with many precious metal companies tapping the equity and debt markets during the year.&#160;&#160;In the current improving global economic environment, the Company intends to preserve capital and maximize cash balances while maintaining flexibility and a strong balance sheet.&#160;&#160;New Gold is committed to maximizing cash balances by increasing operating cash flow, containing costs, controlling expansion capital and reviewing strategic alternatives for non-core assets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold&#8217;s growth plan is focused on organic and acquisition-led growth, and the Company is seeking to be flexible in the current environment to be able to respond to opportunities as they arise, such as acquisitions, debt buybacks and other transactions.&#160;&#160;At current metal prices and after the recent announcements of the El Morro project partnership with Goldcorp, the Amapari transaction and the sale of certain AB Notes, it is expected that the Company&#8217;s existing cash and assets coupled with the cash flow from current operations will be sufficient to fully fund the construction of the New Afton and El Morro projects.&#160;&#160;The new partnership with Goldcorp and monetization of other non-core assets has substantially improved future financing flexibility.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	New Gold&#8217;s 2010 guidance for gold production is 330,000 to 360,000 ounces at a total cash cost
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TEXT-TOP">
	(1)
</FONT>
	of $445 - $465 per ounce of gold sold, net of by-product sales.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

</FONT>
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="21%" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT: 2PX SOLID BLACK; ; BORDER-TOP-STYLE:SOLID; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH:1; BORDER-BOTTOM-STYLE:SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH:1">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Cerro San Pedro Mine
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="33%" STYLE="BORDER-TOP-STYLE: SOLID; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 1; BORDER-BOTTOM-STYLE: SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 1">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Assumptions used in the 2010 forecast include silver and copper prices of $15.00 per ounce and $2.75 per pound, respectively, and Canadian dollar, Australian dollar and Mexican peso exchange rates of 1.11, 1.18 and 13.00 to the U.S. dollar, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	COMMITMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has entered into a number of contractual commitments related to purchases of equipment with long lead times or critical pieces of mining equipment related to the New Afton Project.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009, these commitments totalled $2.1 million and are expected to be paid over the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition to the above, the Company has entered into a number of contractual commitments related to equipment orders to purchase long lead items or critical pieces of mining equipment at its operating mines.&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009, these commitments totalled $10.3 million and are expected to be paid over the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CONTINGENCIES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In assessing the loss contingencies related to legal proceedings that are pending against the Company or unasserted claims that may result in such proceedings, the Company and its legal counsel evaluate the perceived merits of any legal proceedings or unasserted claims as well as the perceived merits of the amount of relief sought or expected to be sought.&#160;&#160;If the assessment of a contingency suggests that a loss is probable, and the amount can easily be estimated, then a loss is recorded.&#160;&#160;When a contingent loss is not probable but if reasonably possible, or is probable but the amount of the loss cannot be reliably estimated, then details of the contingent loss are disclosed.&#160;&#160;Loss contingencies considered remote are generally not disclosed unless they involve guarantees, in which case the Company discloses the nature of the guarantees.&#160;&#160;Legal fees incurred in connection with pending legal proceedings are expensed as incurred.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	A.&#160;&#160;

Certain of the affected parties have or may in the future make legal claims in response to such terminations. The Company cannot reasonably predict the likelihood or outcome of any such actions, but would vigorously defend against them.

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	e)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>

<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has received notice that legal claims alleging environmental damage at the Amapari Mine site have been filed in Brazilian courts against the Company&#8217;s Amapari Mine.&#160;&#160;The Company is defending against these claims.

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	C.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	CERRO SAN PEDRO MINE
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has a history of legal challenges to its Cerro San Pedro Mine. In November 2009, the Company was notified it was required to suspend mining operations at its Cerro San Pedro Mine. Although mining had been suspended, gold recovery operations of existing inventory on the leach pads continued.&#160;&#160;The mining suspension followed&#160;&#160;a ruling by the Federal Court of Fiscal and Administrative Justice nullifying the mine's Environmental Impact Statement EIS which was issued in 2006.&#160;&#160;PROFEPA, the Mexican environmental enforcement agency, issued the order requiring Cerro San Pedro Mine to suspend mining as a consequence of the nullification of the EIS.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company has filed appeals to both the court decision and the PROFEPA order related to the EIS.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	In December, 2009, the Company was granted an injunction related to the suspension of operations at its Cerro San Pedro Mine.&#160;&#160;The court ruling temporarily overturns the PROFEPA order to suspend mining operations at the Cerro San Pedro Mine.&#160;&#160;Subsequent to December 31, 2009, the Company was scheduled to face a hearing in the Fourth District Court in San Luis Potosi, related to a challenge by opposition to the mine to the annual renewal of the explosives permit at Cerro San Pedro.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 40
</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage228"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company is vigorously defending against this challenge and a hearing is scheduled for March 2010.&#160;&#160;Until the hearing is held, no additional blasting will take place at Cerro San Pedro.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Certain directors and officers of New Gold are also directors of a company to which the Company pays royalties in the in the normal course of business.&#160;&#160;Royalty payments were $4.2 million for the year ended December 31, 2009 (2008 - $nil).&#160;&#160;At December 31, 2009, the Company had $1.3 million included as accrued liabilities related to this company (2008 - $nil).&#160;&#160;These transactions were in the normal course of operations and were measured at the exchange amount, which is the amount of consideration established and agreed to by the related party.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	A director of New Gold is also director of the company that purchased from New Gold an interest in the El Morro project.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RISK FACTORS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Readers of this Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis should give careful consideration to the information included or incorporated by reference in this document and the Company&#8217;s audited consolidated financial statements and related notes.&#160;&#160;Significant risk factors for the Company are metal prices, government regulations, foreign operations, environmental compliance, asset backed commercial paper, the ability to obtain additional financing, risk relating to recent acquisitions, dependence on management, title to the Company&#8217;s mineral properties, and litigation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	A.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	METAL PRICES
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Company&#8217;s revenues and cash flows are subject to fluctuations in gold, silver and copper prices.&#160;&#160;At the Peak Mine there can be a significant time lag between the time of recording of copper revenues and final pricing of copper.&#160;&#160;Therefore, changes in the price of copper during this period can have a significant impact on the Company&#8217;s revenue and working capital position.&#160;&#160;Metal prices are affected by a variety of factors including interest rates, exchange rates, international economic and political trends, inflation or deflation, fluctuations in the value of the U.S. dollar and foreign currencies, global and regional supply and demand and the political and economic conditions of major metal producing countries throughout the world.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT">
<DIV>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	B.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The mining, processing, development and exploration activities of the Company are subject to various laws governing prospecting, development, production, taxes, labour standards and occupational health, mine safety, toxic substances, land use, water use, land claims of local people and other matters.&#160;&#160;No assurance can be given that new rules and regulations will not be enacted or that existing rules and regulations will not be applied in a manner which could have an adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s financial position and results of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
